column1: quotes
A great man shows his greatness by the way he treats little men. __Thomas Carlyle
A problem is a chance for you to do your best. __Duke Ellington
Ambition makes more trusty slaves then need. __Ben Jonson
Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.   __ W. Churchill
Be not simply good
Courage is grace under pressure. __Ernest Hemingway
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear not absence of fear. __Mark Twain
Do not treat people as bad as they are, treat then as good as you are. __ Unknown
Fear always springs from ignorance.  __Ralph Waldo Emerson
Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.  __Samuel Johnson
He that is good for making excuses is seldom good for anything else.  __Benjamin Franklin
He who desires but acts not, breeds pestilence. __William Blake
I am an idealist. I do not know where I am going but I\x92m on my way.  __Carl Sandburg
Idleness is only the refuge of weak minds. __Lord Chesterfield
Idleness is only the refuge of weak minds. __Lord Chesterfield
Idleness is to the human mind like rust to iron. __Ezra Cornell
If you are not part of the solution, you are part of the problem. __Eldridge Cleaver
Ignorance is the night of mind, a night without moon or star. ___Confucius
Men talk of killing time when time quietly kill them. __Dion Boucicault
Men talk of killing time when time quietly kills them. __Dion Boucicault
More men fail through lack of purpose than lack of talent. __Billy Sunday
No man is fit to command another that cannot command himself.  __William Penn
No man knows what he can do till he tries.  __Publilinus Syrus
Not failure, but low aim, is crime. __James Russell Lowell
Only mediocrity can be trusted to be always at its best. __Max Beerbohm
People need to be reminded more   often than they need to be instructed. __ Samuel Johnson
Real knowledge is to know the extent of one\x92s ignorance. __Confucius
The beginning is the most important part of the work.  __Plato
The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up. __Andrew Carnegie
The deepest urge in human nature is the desire to be important.  __ John Dewey
The great end of life is not knowledge but action. __Thomas
The harder you work, the luckier you get.  __Gray Player
The human heart refuses to believe in a universe without a purpose.  __Immanuel Kant
The realization of ignorance is the first act of knowing.  ___ Jean Toomer
The realization of ignorance is the first act of knowing. __Jean Toomer
The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.  __Ralph Waldo Emerson
There is nothing like dream to create the future. __Victor Hugo
To escape criticism\x97do nothing, say nothing, be nothing. __Elbert Hubbard
To generalize is to be an idiot.  __William Blake
To generalize is to be an idiot. __William Blake
Violence is a tool of the ignorance.__Flip Wilson
Well done is better than well said. __Benjamin Franklin
